item.title: Notes on Game Theory
item.description: Extensive Game, Perfect Information Strategy Subgame Bargaining textbook 1: (OR) A Course in Game Theory textbook 2: (BM) Fun and games Extensive Game, Perfect Information OR 6.1 Set of players: \(N\) Set of histories: \(H\) History (sequence): \(h = (a^k)_{k=1}^K\) Initial history: \(\emptyset\in H\) \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\), \(K>L\implies (a^k)_{k=1}^L\in H\) \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) for all \(K\in\mathbb{N} \implies (a^k)_{k=1}^{\infty}\in H\) Set of terminal histories: \(Z\) Terminal history: \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) is terminal if exists no \((a^k)_{k=1}^{K+1}\in H\) Set of (possible) actions: \(A(h): \{ a \ | \ (h,a)\in H\) Action: \(a\in h\) for some \(k\in K\) History of length \(k+1\): \((h,a)\) Player function: \(P: (H\backslash Z)\to N\) Player to move after history \(h\): \(P(h)\) Initial player: \(P(\emptyset)\) with \(a^0\in A(\emptyset)\) Second player: \(P(a^0)\) with \(a^1\in A(a^0)\) Preference relation: \(\succsim_i\) defined on \(Z\) Extensive Game with Perfect Information: \(Î“ = \langle N,H,P,(\succsim_i)\rangle\) or \(\langle N,H,P\rangle\) Finite game: \(|H|<\infty\) Finite horizon: \(K <\infty\) for all \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) Rank of game: \(\max K\) for all \((a^k)_{k=1}^K\in H\) Strategy Strategy: \(s_i: (H\backslash Z)\to A(h)\) for \(P(h) = i\) Strategy profile: \(s = (s_i)_{i\in N}\) Outcome of a strategy profile: \(O(s) = (a^1,\dots, a^K)\in Z\)
